intro: Dendropanax williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to the eastern coast of Australia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and is known for its adaptability to sandy soils. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by dark blue berries. Dendropanax williamsii is a hardy shrub that thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions.
